All, am I right in thinking that Ko Akasaka is referring to old Akasaka 
as in, the Shodai, Nidai and maybe, though I am not convinced, the 
Sandai. But the first of the Akasaka smiths ( the oldest ) that had 
heavy influence from Kyo sukashi and Owari works. Am I right in this 
thinking ?.

and while were at it, this looks like the work of the Nidai Tadamasa or 
a student there off, any comment's
http://www.image-hosting.net/images/messageboard/retalt/akasaka.jpg

Cheers and happy new year to you all.

Rich Turner
